bow: changing tables did you use one hello am currently 15 weeks pregnant and looking for some advice did do you use changing table thanks for any input you might have ftm and have lot to learn consider changing tables to be completely useless was given one and used it until the kid could roll over after that it was just hazard much prefer to lay blanket down on the floor or my bed and change there did for the first one but started having back problems because watching other kids in diapers when got pregnant with just could handle the lifting and the pain so started changing them on changing pad on the floor much better we have mid height dresser with changing pad on it fits perfectly plus the top drawer already had dividers which fit wipes diapers and various accessories the other two drawers have her clothes pjs and blankets use mine my back kills me when improvise lo is still an infant so terrible at catching pees in between taking off and putting on new diaper we get pee poo accidents once week and prefer it to happen on the table sure when she gets older ill end up doing it on the floor from fear of her taking fall use freezer with changing pad on it nope we have one but the number of times we ve used it is minimal it nice for the storage underneath though we have found it easier to change him on the floor especially once he got wiggly plus it upstairs in his room and 99 of the time we are downstairs when he needs changed we got basket and created little mobile changing station for the first floor this worked great for me as well had an old dresser bought 15 topper and 20 pad it great height not too much lifting and not too much bending either we used the top of dresser for our first kid we just kept changing pad on it to make it softer and supplies could go in the top drawer for our second kid got basket for supplies and we used the floor with changing pad we just had our third we re just using the floor no accidents on the carpet so far and have the basket for supplies but we re not using it have actually never changed my son anywhere but on the changing table at home we have one that is longways instead of sideways it the best when out and have to use one of those sideways ones in the bathroom struggle because it so awkward upstairs we have curved changing pad on dresser downstairs we have washable changing pad on the dog crate in the den whatever you use check the height the changer on the pack play was so low it hurt to work too long at that level we have changing pad that we sometimes use but it is either on the floor or on the bed mostly we just have towel down on the bed we had changing pad on dresser for the first child and decided to stop doing that after she kept trying to launch herself backwards onto the floor the bed is lot safer plus we are using up more real estate for another piece of furniture love our changing table we still use it and our son is 19 months old it was lifesaver after having cesarean changing pad on top of dresser still using it with my 25 month old and there no chance they ll fall off we still use it for our year old thinking about it now until recently we never changed him anywhere else we used ours ton changed him lot in other places as well but changing table is great for pre and post nap change bedtimes and middle of the night changes thirding this we converted another piece of furniture so we did have to buy changing pad or get rid of one we have changing table and always use it we have peanut diaper changer which is foam changing pad and it is amazing no fabric cover needed yes omg ca leave without it sometimes change her on the sofa year old but still love the changing table also so safe when they re newborns and decide to pee or poop everywhere say get one used for really cheap got mine for 15 repainted it if you do use it you wo care we have changing pad on top of our kitchen table which is great height for changing the squiggliest of worms we do use our kitchen table for eating so there is plenty of room for diapers and supplies it just made sense instead of unitask piece of furniture this will grow with her it ll always be dresser and
